DOC.HEAD: Travelers Urged To Be Careful During Travel Season
DOC.TEXT: About 36 million people nationwide are planning to travel at least 100 miles away from home during the Christmas weekend, a survey is projecting, and safety officials are urging motorists to be extra careful. A national survey of 1,500 adults the U.S. Travel Data Center conducted for the AAA-Chicago Motor Club found that 35.8 million people _ the highest in five years _ are planning to travel during the Christmas weekend. The holiday officially begins at 6 p.m. Friday and ends at 11:59 p.m. on Dec. 25. About 5.2 million people plan to travel by car, the survey found. With so many motorists on the roads and highways, between 320 and 420 people could be killed in car accidents, the National Safety Council said. An additional 15,000 to 19,000 people could suffer disabling injuries, the Safety Council said. During the Christmas holiday season last year, 386 people died in car accidents and about 17,900 were injured. Motorists are urged to avoid drinking and driving and to wear seatbelts, said Bob O'Brien, a spokesman for the Safety Council. In addition, travelers should gas up their cars early because about two-thirds of the nation's gas stations will be closed on Christmas, AAA-Chicago said.
